question_text: Which among the personnel monitoring methods provide a permanent record of radiation exposure?
Which is NOT a principal method of minimizing radiation exposure?
What is the annual allowable exposure limit for occupational radiation workers?
Which of the following statements regarding breast compression is FALSE?

options.A: Causes less geometric blurring of anatomic structures.
options.C: Increases radiation dose to the breast tissues.

question_text: Which of the following is often used for personnel dosimetry?
Which of these radionuclides used in nuclear medicine has a half life of approximately 271 days?
Which of the following features pertain to ultrasound of thick body parts?
What ultrasound interaction produces an echo, which happens when a perpendicular beam encounters tissue boundaries where there is a difference in the acoustic impedance of adjacent materials?
What ultrasound artifact occurs distal to objects having very low ultrasound attenuation such as fluid-filled cavities, manifested as hyperintense signals?
What is the principal component of the fluoroscopy imaging chain that can produce images several thousand times less radiation compared to a speed-screen-film-system?
What form of fluoroscopic procedure offers better image quality where object motion is high?
What image quality factor is the strength of fluoroscopy compared to radiography and the reason for its existence?
Which of the following measures will reduce dose to personnel in the fluoroscopy suite?

options.C: Step forward to the radiation field.
options.D: Wear lead aprons, thyroid shield, eyeglasses.

question_text: Which factor determines slice thickness?
Which of the following exhibits a Hounsfield Unit of -1056?
Increasing which of the following factors will result to improved spatial resolution?
Image ghosting is produced by which of the following?
SPECT Nuclear Imaging uses which rays to generate an image?
In oncology, PET generates images depicting distribution of which material?
Which of the following refers to the difference in the gray scale of the image?
Which of the following has a higher proportion of protons due to the high concentration of hydrogen?
What is the ability of an imaging modality to resolve fine detail in the patient?
Which of these materials have a slightly negative susceptibility and oppose the applied magnetic field?
MR data are initially stored in which space matrix?
Which of the following MR techniques uses multiple phase encode steps in conjunction with multiple 180 degree refocusing radiofrequency pulses per TR interval to produce a train of up to 16 echo?
In MRI, a higher magnetic field strength will result in which of the following?
Which of the following techniques relies on tagging of blood to differentiate moving blood from the surrounding stationary tissues?
Which radiation detector indicates the net amount of energy deposited in the detector by multiple interactions?
Which CT image artifacts occur when the attenuation level of a region in the patient are excessive which can exceed the effective linear range of the detectors?
Which CT image artifacts occur due to calibration error or defective detector on a third generation CT scan?
Which of the following are scintillator materials used in CT scan?
Which CT system uses an entire 360-degree ring of detectors mounted in the stationary frame with a rotating x-ray tube?
What type of high frequency electromagnetic radiation carries sufficient energy per photon to remove bound electrons from the atomic shells?
What type of x-ray is produced by the deceleration of the high-speed electron in an x-ray tube?
Which of the following is caused by both absorption and scattering of the primary protons as it passes through matter?
What is the SI unit of the energy deposited by ionizing radiation per unit mass of material?
Which is the most widely used anode material in diagnostic x-ray?
What term refers to the shift of the x-ray spectrum to higher effective energies as the beam traverses matter?
What is the source of electrons in the x-ray tube?
Which of the following determines the x-ray beam quality and subject contrast?
What is the most common rare earth phosphor used for intensifying screens?
What is the single most important parameter which influences the performance of a grid?
Which of the following cells is the most radioresistant?
What is the marketing term for phosphostimulable phosphor detector (PSP)?
What is the type of light detector that is composed of pixelated electrons and covered with photosensitive silicon?

options.C: Flat panel thin film transistor array detector

question_text: Silver halides (silver bromide and silver iodides) are components of what part of an imaging accessory?
